description: '''Uruguayan rock''' first emerged in [[Uruguay]] in the 1950s. The real breakthrough for rock in Uruguay, however, as in much of the world, came with the arrival of [[The Beatles]] in the early 1960s. Although the country has a small population and is far-removed from the world's cultural centres, rock music from these land, which has always taken on an identity forged from a mix of different cultures (especially, Argentina's and Brazil's, due to proximity) and local peculiarities, crossing different genres and styles, has largely been a well-kept secret outside the region. Thanks to the Internet and easy access to music libraries through streaming services such as [[Spotify]], this is now changing.{{citation needed|date=July 2016}}
